definitions.label_groups: figurative , of policies and rules and their application and enforcement

examples: He was eventually caught, and given a stiff fine.

definitions.definition: Painful or more rigid than usual as a result of excessive or unaccustomed exercise.
examples: My legs are stiff after climbing that hill yesterday.
labels: of muscles or parts of the body
definitions.label_groups: of muscles or parts of the body

examples: a stiff drink; a stiff dose; a stiff breeze

definitions.definition: Having a dense consistency; thick ; ( by extension ) Difficult to stir .
examples: Adding too much peanut butter to your Peanut Sauce recipe may cause your sauce to turn out too stiff .

definitions.definition: Beaten until so aerated that they stand up straight on their own.
examples: beat the egg whites until they are stiff
labels: of whipping cream or egg whites
definitions.label_groups: cooking , of whipping cream or egg whites

definitions.definition: Of an equation , for which certain numerical solving methods are numerically unstable, unless the step size is taken to be extremely small.
Of a shot, landing so close to the flagstick that it should be very easy to sink the ball with the next shot.
Delivered more forcefully than needed, whether intentionally or accidentally, thus causing legitimate pain to the opponent.

main_definition: ( of an object ) Rigid ; hard to bend; inflexible .
secondary_definitions: ( figurative , of policies and rules and their application and enforcement ) Inflexible; rigid.
( of a person ) Formal in behavior; unrelaxed.
( of muscles or parts of the body ) Painful or more rigid than usual as a result of excessive or unaccustomed exercise.
Having a dense consistency; thick ; ( by extension ) Difficult to stir .
( cooking , of whipping cream or egg whites ) Beaten until so aerated that they stand up straight on their own.
( mathematics ) Of an equation , for which certain numerical solving methods are numerically unstable, unless the step size is taken to be extremely small.
( golf ) Of a shot, landing so close to the flagstick that it should be very easy to sink the ball with the next shot.
( professional wrestling , of a strike ) Delivered more forcefully than needed, whether intentionally or accidentally, thus causing legitimate pain to the opponent.
